section.title: Introduction
section.p: The move operation is performed on the subtree corresponding to a given document id and a given area.
We have to :

ul.li: compute a new id (to not overwrite an already existing file)
move the workflow for the new documents
move the node (with the subtree) in the site tree

section.title: Implementation
section.p: It is implemented in a sequence of usecases to get all needed parameters, and uses the task concept to execute some ant task
To perform the different operations on the desired subtree, we used the visitor pattern

section.title: Parameters
section.p: Required parameters:

ul.li: the area for the source document
the document id for the source document
the area for the destination document
the document id for the destination document

section.title: usecase
section.p: They are implemented in the usecase sitmap (core)

section.title: Cut screen
section.p: URL :
usecase sitemap:
section.source: <map:match pattern="cut" type="usecase"> <map:match pattern="showscreen" type="step"> <map:generate src="content/info/cut.xsp" type="serverpages"/> <map:transform src="xslt/info/cut.xsl"/> <map:call resource="style-cms-page"/> </map:match> </map:match>
section.p: The parameters for the source are get with the serverpage through the page envelope input module. A form (build with the xslt transformation) sends then the parameters as request parameters with the new URL.

section.title: Cut confirmation
section.p: URL :
usecase sitemap:
section.source: <map:match pattern="cut" type="usecase"> <map:match pattern="cut" type="step"> <map:act type="session-propagator"> <map:parameter name="org.apache.lenya.cms.info.firstdocid" value="{request-param:documentid}"/> <map:parameter name="org.apache.lenya.cms.info.firstarea" value="{request-param:area}"/> <map:parameter name="org.apache.lenya.cms.info.cutdocumentid" value="{request-param:documentid}"/> <map:parameter name="org.apache.lenya.cms.info.action" value="{request-param:action}"/> <map:redirect-to uri="{request:requestURI}"/> </map:act> </map:match> </map:match>
section.p: The source parameters are saved in the session with the org.apache.cocoon.acting.SessionPropagatorAction
The parameter org.apache.lenya.cms.info.cutdocumentid is used to change the representation of the cutted node in the info sitetree.

section.title: Paste screen
section.p: URL :
usecase sitemap (Core):
section.source: <map:match pattern="paste" type="usecase"> <map:match pattern="showscreen" type="step"> <map:generate src="content/info/paste.xsp" type="serverpages"/> <map:transform src="xslt/info/paste.xsl"/> <map:call resource="style-cms-page"/> </map:match> </map:match>
section.p: The parameters for the destination are get with the serverpage through the page envelope input module. Parameters needed by the access controller are also get with this serverpage through the access control input module. The parameters for the source are get from the session with the serverpage . A form (build with the xslt transformation) sends then the parameters as request parameters with the new URL.

section.title: Paste confirmation
section.p: URL :
usecase sitemap (Core):
section.source: <map:match pattern="paste" type="usecase"> <map:match pattern="paste" type="step"> <map:select type="request-parameter"> <map:parameter name="parameter-name" value="task-id"/> <map:when test="moveDocument"> <map:act type="session-propagator"> <map:parameter name="org.apache.lenya.cms.info.firstdocid" value=""/> <map:parameter name="org.apache.lenya.cms.info.cutdocumentid" value=""/> </map:act> </map:when> <map:otherwise> <map:act type="session-propagator"> <map:parameter name="org.apache.lenya.cms.info.cutdocumentid" value=""/> </map:act> </map:otherwise> </map:select> <map:act type="task"> <map:redirect-to session="true" uri="{request:requestURI}"/> </map:act> </map:match> </map:match>
section.p: The action org.apache.lenya.cms.cocoon.acting.TaskAction calls the execution of the ant task.
The parameter org.apache.lenya.cms.info.cutdocumentid is set to "", because the cutted node is no more present.

section.title: Ant Task
section.p: The ant target moveDocument is in the publication :
and depends on the different targets

ul.li: firstareaproperties, to set the needed properties dependent of the source area
secareaproperties, to set the needed properties dependent of the destination area
newcopydocumentid, to compute the unique destination id
firstdocumentpath, to compute the directory of the source contents (Needed for the revisions and the rcml files)
secdocumentpath, to compute the directory of the destination contents (Needed for the revisions and the rcml files)
move, to execute the different move operations

section.p: More about ant task, see the documentation Ant Task and the Javadoc
